rComments: He gave good feedback on the assignments with the interviews and taught well. Considered 75 above average and there was no clear expectation on what he wanted other than what he wrote in the syllabus. When asked why you got a bad grade, he'll just quote the syllabus. Wouldn't recommend taking the course with him. NOTE: I had othe writing experience

He is absolutely amazing! He is a tough grader and is particular about attendance but he is equally caring, motivating and hilarious. His lectures are extremely entertaining but informative at the same time. You will definitely finish the course as a better writer.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Tough grader', 'Amazing lectures']

rComments: Im not sure why he has such high praise. He only thinks writing is good if it follows his personal tastes. Hes unkind to students and kids in my class were afraid to talk to him. He thinks hes more interesting and qualified than he is.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Hes a great professor! Pushes students to try their best and get out of their shell. The editorial groups help students make friends. The classes are amazing because you get to know your peers on such a great personal level. Tip: Dont write for marks, write from the soul and make it interesting. This is the only way to get above a %70.

My new fav prof at UTM! Strict but incredibly kind, encouraging and understanding. Is almost always available for extra help. He will push you to do your best and work for a good grade. He will make your writing better! Excited to take more classes with him in the future :)
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Gives good feedback', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Robert Price is the best prof Ive had at UTM. Hes extremely understanding, encouraging and accessible. If I was having trouble with the assignments or couldnt make it to class he always makes himself available for extra help. He actually cares about each individual and our growth as writers. 10/10 will be taking more of his classes
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: A hard prof but he makes the class worth it. He's good at encouraging students and keeping the lecture content and class discussions engaging. Make as many one-on-one appointments with him as you can, the more the better. It really helps with improving your writing. He was the best prof I had this term.
Extremely nice prof and makes sure that you work hard for your grade. The PWC program in general has high standards, but he really helps out to improve your writing.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: He has received many more positive votes than negatives, and I'd like to point out that if you did the work, and made an effort, and were passionate about your writing, you probably wouldn't have hated it so much.
Skip class? You won't pass. Amazing lectures and a great Stephen King style sense of humour.

The best professor I have ever had. If you want to do well, you will do well. He is so engaged and is always available to help with editing. He is not ambiguous with what he wants. He is clear and concise and does everything he can to help students get to where they need to be. TAKE ANYTHING YOU CAN WITH HIM!!
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Lots of homework', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Hardest professor I've ever had. You can put in so much work, but his criteria is ambiguous, which means you won't do well unless he likes your writing style.

Very clear instruction, uses many examples. Cares about students' success and makes them work hard for their grade. Uses humour in class to keep students from dozing off. Don't be late for class and don't skip class. You need to hand in every exercise and assignment before class begins. Class was very useful and fun
teacherRatingTags: ['Participation matters', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: The interviews that you meet up with him for are extremely helpful and encouraging - though a little intimidating. His criticisms are on point and he's very clear.

worst pwc prof. has no compassion for his students. during the strike last year, he didn't bother telling us he won't show up until 10 minutes before class, while we were all waiting in his class. AVOID HIM AT ALL COSTS!!
Great Professor. Drastically enhanced my writing in his course.

He is a nice person overall. He provides helpful feedback for editing decisions. He can be ambiguous when it comes to marking, even when you follow guidelines. He can be picky. It is difficult to get a high mark in his class if your writing is not to his taste.
teacherRatingTags: ['Participation matters', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'So many papers']

rComments: Professor Price is cool. He does assign a lot of homework but they're fairly doable. Just plan your time accordingly - it isn't nuclear physics. Yes, he may mark a little bit hard if he thinks you're not pulling in the effort. Also, make sure to participate and show up to class too.

I've taken two courses from this professor so I probably have a better idea of how he's like compared to the other raters. He's the kind of the professor that gives a lot of homework, but it's very doable if you plan accordingly. Just make sure to do the assignments, show up to class and participate....I'm actually life sci student, it's doable.

He's a good prof, he makes sure you work hard for that grade. Be sure to actually show up to class and do all the assignments on time or else you'll lose marks. If you're taking this course for fun, you might not like it since he expects a lot material in a short span of time. I liked his approachability though.

He was pretty awful. He seems like the kind of man that goes home every night to an empty house. He was rude and condescending right from the first day. I honestly left his class feeling drained and depressed. The man is a walking storm cloud. Stay away.
all profs should be like Price - gives great understanding of course material, actually cares about your improvement, and treats you like a "person" rather than a student.
He's really great with emails and very accommodating if you actually care about the class.

I'm not a massive fan. He's incredibly anal about you coming to class every week and seems reluctant to understand that you have other things to do sometimes. He's very depressing and self deprecating. People in my class had shaking voices because they were so scare to talk to him. I wouldn't take another class with him.

AMAZING PROF! Make sure you attend all classes and scheduled appointments. Don't be late for class, he's super anal about that. But other than that amazing prof, made me want to major in professional writing and communication. The exercises are easy but there are a lot, so be prepared to do the homework.
My favorite writing prof. Nicest guy, even after I finished my term, constantly visiting his office and having lengthy chats. Low talker, great writer, great teacher, great guy.
Attend class, do the exercises, make the appointments, use 203 as a guideline and he'll be just fine. Keep it simple.
He got his start writing textbooks and then moved on to writing business articles. He writes like a robot and expects you to write like a robot.
Likes simple writing and straight to the point
Really good professor. He teaches with passion - Great lectures - Class always flew by.
He's really good, really knows his stuff. Fun class. Like others have said, attend all lectures. Edit, edit, and edit your writing.
Make sure you attend all classes and participate. He's an okay professor and marker.
Great professor. Fair marker. Very helpful at editing sessions.
Easy-going, friendly, helpful - overall a great prof!
